title: Kinsman Mountain
text:
Kinsman Mountain is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in <a href="Grafton%20County%2C%20New%20Hampshire">Grafton County</a>, <a href="New%20Hampshire">New Hampshire</a>. It is named after <a href="Nathan%20Kinsman">Nathan Kinsman</a>, an early resident of <a href="Easton%2C%20New%20Hampshire">Easton, New Hampshire</a>, and is part of the <a href="Kinsman%20Range">Kinsman Range</a> of the <a href="White%20Mountains%20%28New%20Hampshire%29">White Mountains</a>. To the northeast, Kinsman is connected by <a href="The%20Cannon%20Balls">The Cannon Balls</a> ridge to <a href="Cannon%20Mountain%20%28New%20Hampshire%29">Cannon Mountain</a>.
The west side of Kinsman drains into Reel and Slide Brooks, thence into the <a href="Ham%20Branch">Ham Branch</a> of the <a href="Gale%20River">Gale River</a>, the Gale River, <a href="Ammonoosuc%20River">Ammonoosuc River</a>, <a href="Connecticut%20River">Connecticut River</a>, and into <a href="Long%20Island%20Sound">Long Island Sound</a> in <a href="Connecticut">Connecticut</a>. 
The east side drains into Cascade Brook, thence into the <a href="Pemigewasset%20River">Pemigewasset River</a>, the <a href="Merrimack%20River">Merrimack River</a>, and into the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Maine">Gulf of Maine</a> in <a href="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</a>. 
The south face drains into Eliza Brook, thence into Harvard Brook, another <a href="tributary">tributary</a> of the Pemigewasset.
The <a href="Appalachian%20Mountain%20Club">Appalachian Mountain Club</a> considers both North and South Kinsman to be "<a href="four-thousand%20footers">four-thousand footers</a>" because the divide between them gives the former more than of <a href="topographic%20prominence">topographic prominence</a>. 
South Kinsman is the sixth most prominent of the White Mountains, because it is the highest point between <a href="Franconia%20Notch">Franconia Notch</a> and <a href="Kinsman%20Notch">Kinsman Notch</a>.
Hikers climbing North Kinsman Mountain, when reaching the viewless summit, should be sure to take a short bushwhack east to steep granite ledges falling off to Kinsman Pond and offering views of <a href="Cannon%20Mountain%20%28New%20Hampshire%29">Cannon Mountain</a>, South Kinsman, <a href="Franconia%20Ridge">Franconia Ridge</a>, and <a href="Lonesome%20Lake%20%28New%20Hampshire%29">Lonesome Lake</a>.
